description:
The internship provides students with an opportunity to apply sociological knowledge to the workplace. In particular, students learn about the challenges of
workplace situations, and reflect upon how practising sociology may provide clarity to problems encountered. Internships must take place in organizations or companies, be relevant to sociology, consist at least 120 hours for SC3550 (or 240 hours for ISC3550), and be approved by the Department to be considered for credit. This module is not compulsory and will be credited as a Major Elective or a
combination of Major Elective and Unrestricted Elective.
title: Extended Sociology Internship
